intro: Osbeckia septemnervia, commonly known as the seven-veined willow herb, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have seven prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. Osbeckia septemnervia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
